text: Alan Robert Rabinowitz (December 31, 1953 â€“ August 5, 2018) was an American zoologist. He was the chief scientist at Panthera Corporation, a nonprofit conservation organization devoted to protecting the world's 40 wild cat species. He was called the "Indiana Jones of Wildlife Protection" by Time. He studied jaguars, clouded leopards, Asiatic leopards, tigers, Sumatran rhinos, bears, leopard cats, raccoons, and civets. On August 5, 2018, Rabinowitz died from leukemia in Manhattan, aged 64. ==References== Category:2018 deaths Category:American zoologists Category:1953 births Category:American Jews Category:People from Brooklyn Category:Scientists from New York City Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Deaths from leukemia
